ratings.comment: She cares a lot about students, and tries to make the material as enjoyable as possible. Relatively easy, you can't go wrong here.

Prof. Jackson clearly cares about all of her students, and wants people to do well in her class. Lectures were relevant , and often used movie clips to break up slides. Always greeted everyone everyone with a smile before class.

Attendance required before and the day of quizzes. Quizzes are pretty specific so study the slides. Really cares about the students and the material. No final exam, just a paper. Show up and you'll get an A.

The professor is really nice and friendly, and presents lectures very well. Attendance is mandatory the lecture before the quiz and the day of the quiz. I would recommend going to lectures because then you probably won't need to study for the quizzes or the midterms. They're really focused on big ideas of the lectures, and they're pretty easy.
I LOVE HER! So passionate, caring, and respectful of students. Wow, I even learned so much about a subject I was not originally interested in. Thank you, Prof!

LOVE Professor Jackson. She is an amazing lecturer who truly loves what she does. I have never loved attending a class more than her HS 202 class. As a neurobio major I'm not big history person, but she made it interesting and I found everything so fascinating. The unit tests weren't too bad as long as you review. TA Eric Luckey was awesome too

Great professor who really loves what she does. It was really refreshing to have a professor so passionate about their field. I also took the class for honors credits and found the project easy but a bit strange considering it was her husbands book we were reading and commenting on. She was more than willing to help out on all writing assignments.

She was engaging and knowledgeable about the topics she discussed.  All of her lectures told great stories that were interesting and fun to listen to in her lovely accent.  I took the class just because I needed some humanities credits, but ended up loving it!

By far the best prof I've had while at Madison. Extremely intelligent and interesting. She's really passionate about what she teaches, and that's evident in her lectures. Understands that most students have other classes, so the work load is easy. Takes time to get to know her students which is refreshing.

Professor Jackson asked my class to come in on a Saturday morning to present projects/what we learned; it was optional and would not affect our grade. All but 2 students showed up. This is an example of how interesting, compelling and kind Prof Jackson is as a teacher. She is a generous grader who is passionate about her material and her students.

I loved her class.  She is one of the best professors I've ever had.  Her class is easy because she is a complete ace of a teacher.  I loved showing up and I loved hearing what she had to say on a bi daily basis.  Was a blast.

She's great.  Your grades are mostly based off of essays and when I figured out I was terrible at them she would help me before every essay and basically help me rewrite the paper so it didn't suck as bad.  Lectures are interesting, and occasionally you get candy which makes the whole thing feel more personal.  Also her accent is awesome. Got an AB

Professor Jackson is an excellent lecturer. She leads the class well and clearly knows the material. One midterm, a few one-page essays, and easy quizzes. A very interesting class taught by a really engaging professor.

Professor Jackson is very cool. Her lectures are extremely well organized and clear. No exams, but essays make up the majority of your grade (could be good or bad). Her British accent makes lectures that much more interesting.
